Practice Bodhisattva, together with seventy-seven thousand such bodhisattvas, said like this:
All good and virtuous friends!
We have received these flowers from the Buddha and now offer them to you. Take these flowers to assist in the Buddha's path. You should all single-mindedly make great vows together.
At that time, the seventy-seven thousand bodhisattvas took these lotus flowers and simultaneously made great expedient vows, and then offered them back to the Buddha.
The Buddha, out of compassion, accepted it and told Maitreya:
I am now at peace and can enable you to plant great wholesome roots.
Ajita!
The Buddhas are difficult to encounter, and the Bodhisattvas are also difficult to meet.

You should know that all the merits and virtues of the Buddhas are in the mind of initial subjugation. Therefore, bodhisattvas are difficult to encounter in the world, and the Buddha is also difficult to meet.
Ajita!
It is like this: if there are no cows, there is no ghee. In the same way, if there is no bodhisattva giving rise to the aspiration for enlightenment, there is no Buddha lineage;
if there are cows, then there is ghee. In the same way, if there are bodhisattvas giving rise to the aspiration for enlightenment, the Buddha lineage is not cut off.
